subject: AI & Agents
title: The Goldilocks Prompt: Not Too Long, Not Short
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Goldilocks Prompt: Not Too Long, Not Short usable.

hook.text: Your one-liner prompt is ambiguous. Your 3-page prompt is ignored halfway through.

buildup.text: Too short = underspecified. Too long = diluted attention and wasted tokens.

discovery.text: Sweet spot: clear role, specific task, 2‚Äì3 constraints, one output example.

twist.text: If your prompt needs a page, the task might need decomposition instead.

climax.text: Test: remove one sentence at a time. If output doesn't change, that sentence was noise.

punchline.text: Every word in a prompt should earn its keep.

quiz.question: How do you find the right prompt length?
options: Remove sentences and test if output changes
Always use the longest prompt possible
